li.a: Watch this space for important notifications.

h3.a: Superintendent's Message-The Suspension of Face-to-Face Instruction

div.p:
Dear Parents and Members of the Pleasant Hill School Community:
I hope this message finds you and your families safe and well. I write to you today with the news that Governor Pritzker has announced remote learning will be extended through the end of the 2019-20 school year.
Like you and many of our students, we are saddened by the reality that our school community will not be able to reconvene in person this year due to this public health crisis. So many of our students have worked hard to learn and grow both in the . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Superintendent's Message-The Suspension of Face-to-Face Instruction

div.p:
Dear Parents and Guardians:
In an effort to provide a clear understanding of this uncharted and difficult situation for everyone in our school community, Pleasant Hill Community Unit #3 would like to provide the following information about Remote Learning in our district.
The Illinois State Board of Education (ISBE) has charged us with the following objectives during the COVID-19 crisis:
Provide for the emotional and physical safety of our students. Ensure that food service is provided to our . . .

h3.a: Pleasant Hill CUSD #3 Response to Extension of Stay at Home Order

div.p:
March 31, 2020
Dear Pleasant Hill Parents, Employees and Community Members:
I hope this message finds you and your families safe and well. Today, Illinois Governor JB Pritzker announced that remote learning in Illinois will be extended through April 30 in order to slow down the spread of COVID-19.
During this time, on-site learning will remain suspended, but our schools’ commitment to learning and education will remain open and learning will continue for all students - just through a different format. . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Pleasant Hill CUSD #3 Response to Extension of Stay at Home Order

h3.a: Complete List of Online Educational Resources

div.p:
Here is a list of online programs that our district currently holds subscriptions for. For login questions or concerns, please e-mail your child's classroom teacher.
This list will be updated as we gather additional resources for online learning.
Website Link

a.aria-label: Read more about Complete List of Online Educational Resources

div.p:
Please read the following from Superintendent, Ron Edwards:
Dear Pleasant Hill CUSD #3 Families:
The health and safety of our students is our top priority. We want to share with you current information that the Illinois Department of Public Health (IDPH) has published for schools throughout the state.
The good news at this time is that the health risk to the general healthy public from coronavirus remains low. Currently, the IDPH recommends schools hold classes and events as usual, and follow . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Coronavirus Precautions

div.p:
TeacherEase has recently been working on mobile apps. In their latest release, they upgraded the iOS TeacherEase parent/student app to receive notifications when events occur in the system (grade is entered, student is marked absent, announcement is sent, etc). Users stay updated without needing to login.
They implemented mobile notifications by leveraging the Feed already within TeacherEase. Whenever a feed item is generated, it can be pushed out as mobile app notification . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about TeacherEase Mobile App Enhancements

div.p: Pleasant Hill CUSD #3 has been approved to participate as a sponsor in the School Nutrition Program district wide for Program Year 2020. This means FREE breakfast and lunch for ALL students in our district for 2019-20 school year. No free lunch applications will need to be completed and submitted for this school year. If families do have remaining balances from last year, we would appreciate those funds being remitted as soon as possible. You should have received a free book/course fee application in your packets . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about FREE LUNCH SCHOOL WIDE FOR 2019-2020

div.p:
We are pleased to announce we now offer online webpay.
You will see in the fifth button position at the top in white, “online webpay” on our webpage. Once you press this button, it will redirect you to our Vanco Services secure website to process your payments and/or donations. Once you complete the 1 st page it will direct you to the 2 nd page for payment information. You can make payments from any credit/debit card and/or checking/savings account. This software also allows you to . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Online Webpay is Here!
